newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Lone Star Steakhouse off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Lone Star Steakhouse off.

text.p: Shares in Lone Star Steakhouse & Saloon Inc traded lower ahead of the opening on Wall Street after the company forecast lower-than-expected third quarter earnings, traders said.
One trader cited a Lone Star trade at 17-1/2, another noted a trade at 17-1/4, down sharply from the stock's close Monday at 22.
After the market's close Monday, Lone Star said it expects third quarter earnings to be $0.10 to $0.13 a share below analysts estimates.

According to First Call, 10 analysts were estimating Lone Star's third quarter earnings in a range of $0.45 to $0.50 a share with a mean estimate of $0.47. The company earned $0.38 in the 1996 third quarter.

Elsewhere, shares in Micro Warehouse Inc rose after topping estimates with its second quarter profits. Late Monday the company posted earnings of $0.23 a share, which beat the mean analyst estimate of $0.16, according to I/B/E/S.
The stock was trading at 18-3/4, up from Monday's close at 17-6/16, one trader said. Another cited a trade at 18-1/2.

Shares in Huntington Bancshares Inc rose after the shares were added to the Standard & Poor's 500 index, which typically leads to buying by fund managers tracking the index. The stock traded at 31-7/8 after closing Monday at 28-7/16, traders said.
Huntington replaces ENSERCH Corp in the S&P 500. ENSERCH traded at 22, off its Monday close at 22-5/16, traders said.
